Yorick isn't fun to lane against, and I always feel like I can't do anything with his poke on him me while he's farming, but outside the ult, when's the last time you heard about Yorick being useful to his team? Besides, every champion takes skill to use their strengths most efficiently, no matter who it is, yes the kit may be simple but it takes knowledge of the situation and knowledge of your champion to know if you can actually win in the situation. You have to know your champ, how others affect your champ, what situations your champ can survive, how best to use your abilities in certain situations as well as the most effective rotation of said abilities. So yes, even Garen and Annie take skill, and as much as I hate to admit it, so does Lux...

Let's be honest, people just don't enjoy doing badly during laning or losing games no matter what champion they are playing against.  With Yorick, most people just don't see him often enough to learn how to deal with him.  When people see a Yorick for the first time in 300+ games, chances are that they don't know what do with the matchup.  When people don't understand a matchup, they will be disadvantaged and will often become frustrated.  But, since they probably won't see another Yorick for 300+ more games, they aren't likely to remember any of the lessons they learned next time around.

Outside of his ultimate, his kit is extremely similar to Darius, except Yorick has worse all-ins, slightly better ability ranges, is more mana hungry, and you can remove his DOT (ghoul aggro) unlike Darius's Hemorrhage bleed.  He is actually a far more forgiving lane opponent than Darius is, since he doesn't snowball nearly as hard and he can be counterbuilt with some sustain.  Nine times out of ten when people do badly against a top lane Yorick, it's because they expect Yorick to be a trash pick so they don't respect his space like they would laning against Darius.

The idea that Yorick is worthless after laning is another Yorick myth.  His Q + W + E is as powerful as Darius's after laning and his finished {{item:3042}} is a nice lategame powerspike.  Yorick doesn't snowball like Darius at the end of laning because he doesn't have Darius's midgame kill potential, but Yorick's ultimate lets him fill his niche as the utility/teamplay juggernaut perfectly after laning.  I can guarantee you that most people who actually play Yorick feel that he is plenty rewarding and useful after laning.  His ultimate definitely has a lot of flexibility and non-selfish power after laning, but the rest of his kit still packs a punch all game long.  I personally love how he transitions into a supportive carry lategame, rather than greedily hogging all of the team's kills like some Darius players will do with their ultimate, because I enjoy helping my teammates succeed.

I realize that statement about Yorick was a lot more negative than I had intended, so I apologize, what I had meant was Yorick at least won't be bullying you outside of the lane as much. And it is true that losing lane is always unfun, but Yorick doesn't leave himself open to much counterplay outside his mana crisis in laning. I apologize again for essentially calling Yorick useless in my previous statement. I can also agree that Darius has much better all-ins, and they hurt, a lot.

I remember the time when yorick had almost nasus status. Lock him down early or mid or suffer his wrath late. The guy used to practically steamroll all manner of champions going into late game while having enough sustain to fight at least 3-4 of the enemy team.

I don't mind losing my lane if the rest of my team is winning, I like forcing my lane opponents so hard that I have their jungler and mid up top as much as their top laner.

When they get to the Yorick rework it is my hope that they give him some kind of Anti CC on his Ult, maybe not the full duration of his Ult but enough to let him or his target just run straight into the enemy team as an initiate.  Seems like a juggernaut thing to do, walk straight into the enemy team and /dance!
